lexUnit.name: glint.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small flash of light, especially a reflected one.

sentence.text: At first , all he could see was the glint of water and the dark outline of the Isle of Wight , across the Solent .
I waded out , concentrating on casting towards the weeds , where I had seen a good fish rise , when a glint of white under the water caught my eye .
Leonie noticed a glint of anger flash through the Cap 's eyes .
She saw the glint of a silver helmet and the slender figure of a Woman .
From within the deep dark hood , Nuadu caught the sudden glint of white bone and heard the guttural laugh .
Among the willows I caught a glint of blue , and then saw Ninian , who must have been up early after all , stooping over something at the edge of the stream .
Schramm saw a glint of turquoise blue and walked down to the harbour .
She turned to the other girl and was surprised to see a glint of tears .
From both there was a glint of recognition and Betty said , ` hello , Sheena . "
One had slipped out of an alley in front of him ; he saw the glint of a knife .
One evening as you came into your room you caught sight of a red glint within the wall .
His eyes held a slightly impatient glint below his frown .
Barton saw a few metallic glints at great distance .
But ah , there 's the gunmetal glint I seek .
For a split second the friendliness disappeared from Marianne 's eyes to be replaced by a calculating glint .
` I suppose so , " she admitted reluctantly , eyes carrying a teasing glint as she lifted them to his .
Lucenzo had a glint in his eyes which told her she could be in trouble .
Hickery Holler came into the world 6 weeks ago , but the sad little spider monkey had never been a bright glint in his mother 's eye .
Portillo , however , has a glint in his eye .
With an impish glint of mischief in her eye the Muse of History looked down and watched the American Marines assault Grenada .
` Your father did n't warn me quite what a striking young woman you had grown into , " the Princesse said in English with a wry glint in her eye .
` An asymmetrical spinnaker is on order , " said Mary , with an excited glint in her eye .
He stopped a pace or two away from the bed and regarded her with an unexpectedly teasing glint in his eyes .
She stopped to peruse the plans once more , a greedy glint in her eyes .
` Some bastard will pay for this ! " he hissed , the glint of madness in his eyes .
His frowning gaze swept over her and there was a glint in the blue eyes that might have been intimidating if she were n't so angry .
` I 'm -- fond of Travis -- very fond , " she stated , then caught the dangerous glint in her employer 's eye that assured her that her prevarication was n't going down too well .
The harvest had been gathered and she was vaguely conscious of the glint of the sun on the gold and brown stubble .
Meredith caught the glint of gold in the thread .
